comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Image is reversed and making me giddy!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Looks like the photographer is Henry King.
Certainly pre-1890 as there is no Fire Station.
The original glass negative might well be in the Tyrrell Collection at the Powerhouse Museum - I will look.
Any chance of higher resolution please?

comment.author: 11334970@N05
comment._content:
Hi beachcomberaustralia,

Thank you for spotting that the image is reversed. I'll re-upload it shortly.

It would be fantastic if you could locate the original glass negative at the Powerhouse and help us to improve our information on this picture.

Many thanks for your help!

Lucinda

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nationalmaritimemuseum] Thanks Lucinda, that looks much better. No luck with a PhM original so far. Henry King did take many photographs around Circular Quay in the 1880s, including this one (90 degrees to the right) of "Wool Ships, Circular Quay". Someone may be able to identify the clipper ships in it. - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362703683/] Or mega zoom - from.ph/30480

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: And the SLNSW (Government Printing Office) version - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=188735 . including the id of CUTTY SARK.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] This photo is slightly earlier than the Hall one - before 1887 is the best I can find so far, due to the Russell Hotel not being there (see note) - therussell.com.au/ .

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: And a hi-res cropped version from SLV - handle.slv.vic.gov.au/10381/33431 Scroll down to 5/5.
